credits.title: Twórcy i współpracownicy Scratcha
credits.developers: Scratch jest stworzony i rozwijany przez Lifelong Kindergarten Group w laboratorium mediów MIT:
credits.moderators: Moderatorzy zarządzają internetową społecznością Scratcha, wspierają ją i ulepszają.
credits.previousTitle: Byli członkowie zespołu Scratch przy MIT.
credits.previousBody: Many important contributions have been made by previous Scratch Team members, including John Maloney (who led software development for the first decade of Scratch) and Andrés Monroy-Hernández (who led the development of the first Scratch community website). Other contributors include:
credits.partnersBody: Paula Bontá and Brian Silverman, Playful Invention Company (who started contributing to the design of Scratch even before it was called Scratch).
credits.researchersBody: Research on Scratch is being conducted by members of the MIT Scratch Team and researchers at other universities, including Yasmin Kafai (who collaborated on the initial NSF Scratch grant) at the University of Pennsylvania Graduate School of Education, Karen Brennan (who leads the ScratchEd project) at the Harvard Graduate School of Education, Benjamin Mako Hill at the University of Washington, Andrés Monroy Hernández at Microsoft Research, Mimi Ito and Crystle Martin at the University of California, Irvine, Quinn Burke at College of Charleston, Deborah Fields at Utah State University, and Kylie Peppler at Indiana University.
credits.acknowledgementsContributors: The following people have also contributed to the development and support of Scratch over the years:
credits.acknowledgementsTranslators: Dzięki pomocy tłumaczy z całego świata Scratch jest dostępny w wielu językach.
credits.acknowledgementsCommunity: We greatly appreciate all of the contributions by members of the worldwide Scratch community, who have shaped the direction of Scratch by sharing their projects, comments, and ideas.
credits.acknowledgementsInfluencers: W naszych pracach inspirowaliśmy się ideami Seymoura Paperta i Alana Kaya.
credits.supportersFinancialHeader: Organizacje, które najbardziej wsparły Scratcha finansowo:
credits.supportersServicesHeader: Organizacje, które podarowały usługi, dzięki którym projekt Scratch może funkcjonować:
credits.supportersOpenHeader: Scratch nie byłby możliwy bez wolnego oprogramowania i oprogramowania open source, w tym:
